security: Sharing the transcript of the Senate Select Committee hearing, particularly Director Kelley’s statements, could reveal the FBI’s operational concerns and adjustments made in response to congressional oversight. Disclosing these internal assessments and proposed reforms may undermine ongoing intelligence efforts and allow adversaries to anticipate and counteract future FBI strategies. Quoting directly: “Probably the most important question here today is what assurances I can give that the errors and abuses which arose under the Counterintelligence Programs will not occur again?” Also, “Today we place a high premium on openness, openness both within and without the service.” These statements open the FBI to scrutiny regarding its adherence to these assurances.
summary: This document contains a routing slip, a teletype concerning an Organized Crime Regional Training Conference, and a transcript from a Senate Select Committee hearing featuring Director Clarence M. Kelley discussing FBI intelligence activities.
summary_one_paragraph: The file consists of several items: a routing slip indicating the return of files for review and determination of their disposition; a teletype from the Director of the FBI to field offices regarding an Organized Crime Regional Training Conference in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania, in September 1984, with a request for the Miami Division to designate attendees due to its involvement with East Coast La Cosa Nostra families; and a transcript of a December 10, 1975, Senate Select Committee hearing featuring Director Clarence M. Kelley discussing FBI intelligence activities and responding to questions about past abuses and future safeguards.
title: Various Documents: Routing Slip, Training Conference Teletype, and Senate Hearing Transcript with FBI Director Clarence M. Kelley
